page.title: 10CARE AND CONSERVATION
page.content: In 1930 it was proposed to make a conservation area around the original garden village built,1926_1930.This was to preserve both the historic value to town planning of The Garden City concept and the early'modern movement'architecture.Most of the village remained unaltered until 1980 when tennants were granted buying rights.The conservation area is to guard against unwanted changes and was accepted by a majority vote,but much heated controversy followed.Some home owners are annoyed that approval is still needed for any alterations,new windows and colour wash.The council tennants however,seem happy with the situation and their houses are being modernised.A school survey decided that play areas,the park and shops had too much litter.More bins are needed, placed at lower levels for children.
